title: Amor Y Cohetes - The Love and Rockets Library
description:
'Amor Y Cohetes - The Love and Rockets Library (2008)'

Fantagraphics Books, 2008, 289 pages

Los Bros. Hernandez - Gilbert, Jaime, Mario

To a very great extent, Love and Rockets is synonymous with Hoppers' Maggie & Hopey and Palomar's Luba & Carmen & Heraclio & Tonantzin... but there was always more to L&R than that. Amor Y Cohetes finally collects together in one convenient package all the non-Maggie and non-Palomar stories by all three Hernandez Brothers from that classic first, 50-issue Love and Rockets series Ã¢â‚¬â€ a dizzying array of styles and approaches that re-confirms these groundbreaking cartoonists' place in the history of comics.

The book leads off with Gilbert's original 40-page sci-fi epic Ã¢â‚¬Å“BEMÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ from 1981's very first issue of Love and Rockets, featuring a very different Luba and a much looser, Heavy Metal- and Marvel Comics-inspired way of storytelling.

Other stories include Jaime's charming Ã¢â‚¬Å“Rocky and FumbleÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ series starring a planet-hopping girl and her robot; stunning one-shots such as Gilbert's Frida Kahlo biography Ã¢â‚¬Å“FridaÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and his shocking autobiographical fantasia Ã¢â‚¬Å“My Love BookÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½; MarioÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s genre thrillers which take place Ã¢â‚¬Å“Somewhere in CaliforniaÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½; Gilbert's brutally dystopian Ã¢â‚¬Å“Errata StigmataÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ stories; the playful Ã¢â‚¬Å“Hernandez Satyricon,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ with Gilbert drawing Jaime's characters, and Ã¢â‚¬Å“War Paint,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ with Jaime trying out Palomar; Gilbert's light-hearted Ã¢â‚¬Å“Music for MonstersÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ starring Bang and Inez; and even a fantastical Ã¢â‚¬Å“non-continuityÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ Maggie and Hopey story Ã¢â‚¬Å“Easter HuntÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ by Jaime that didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t fit into the other books.

Amor Y Cohetes, the seventh (and concluding, for now) volume in the new Ã¢â‚¬Å“Complete Love and RocketsÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ shows a very different side of Los Bros Hernandez.
